code: @Manual{,   title = {SMPD4: SMPD4-Related Clinical Phenotype Data},   author = {Dean Marchiori},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 2.1.0},   url = {https://deanmarchiori.github.io/SMPD4}, }

title: SMPD4-Related Clinical Phenotype Data
text: goal SMPD4 provide analysis ready data sets SMPD4 data. Sphingomyelin Phosphodiesterase 4 (SMPD4) type sphinogmyelinase protein encoded SMPD4 gene. Patients bi-allelic loss function variants gene associated condition known neurodevelopmental disorder microcephaly, arthrogryposis, structural brain anomalies (NEDMABA; 618622). cases exist scientific literature Magini et al. (2019) reporting 23 members 12 unrelated families. genotype-phenotype relationship NEDMABA heterogeneous aside case-reports, little data available statistical analysis. Magini et al. (2019) offer supplementary table summarised clinical phenotype data included subjects. Unfortunately data non standardised, heterogeneous largely textual based. isolated examples exist papers case studies, also included (Bijarnia-Mahay et al. (2022), Ji et al. (2022), Monies et al. (2019), Ravenscroft et al. (2020)). project aims standardise process data tidy format (Wickham (2014)) analysis-ready extensible researchers better understand relationship clinical factors discovered literature.

title: SMPD4-Related Clinical Phenotype Data
text: can install development version SMPD4 GitHub :

title: SMPD4-Related Clinical Phenotype Data
code: library(SMPD4)  data("magini_2019") head(magini_2019[,1:20]) #>    study         id family individual deceased survival_time variant_type #> 1 Magini Magini_1_1      1          1     TRUE            30   homozygote #> 2 Magini Magini_1_2      1          2     TRUE            60   homozygote #> 3 Magini Magini_1_3      1          3     TRUE            30   homozygote #> 4 Magini Magini_1_4      1          4     TRUE          1095   homozygote #> 5 Magini Magini_2_1      2          1     TRUE          2190   homozygote #> 6 Magini Magini_2_2      2          2    FALSE          1825   homozygote #>   locus_1 locus_2 gender ethnicity consanguineous termination birth_gestation #> 1    1320      NA female   Turkish           TRUE       FALSE              39 #> 2    1320      NA   male   Turkish           TRUE       FALSE              37 #> 3    1320      NA   male   Turkish           TRUE       FALSE              36 #> 4    1320      NA female   Turkish           TRUE       FALSE              38 #> 5    1483      NA female   Morocco           TRUE       FALSE              37 #> 6    1483      NA   male   Morocco           TRUE       FALSE              37 #>   route_vaginal_vs_c_sect birth_weight birth_ofc birth_length age_at_demise #> 1                     SVD         2175      30.5           NA            30 #> 2                      CS         1860      31.0           NA            60 #> 3                      CS         1955      30.0           NA             2 #> 4                      CS         2780      30.5           41          1095 #> 5                      CS         2045      29.0           39          2190 #> 6                      CS         2300        NA           NA            NA #>   age_at_last_follow_up #> 1                    30 #> 2                    60 #> 3                    30 #> 4                  1095 #> 5                    NA #> 6                  1825

title: SMPD4-Related Clinical Phenotype Data
text: Bijarnia-Mahay, S., Somashekar, P. H., Kaur, P., Kulshrestha, S., Ramprasad, V. L., Murugan, S., … & Shukla, . (2022). Growth neurodevelopmental disorder arthrogryposis, microcephaly structural brain anomalies caused Bi-allelic partial deletion SMPD4 gene. Journal human genetics, 67(3), 133-136. Magini, P., Smits, D. J., Vandervore, L., Schot, R., Columbaro, M., Kasteleijn, E., … & Mancini, G. M. (2019). Loss SMPD4 causes developmental disorder characterized microcephaly congenital arthrogryposis. American Journal Human Genetics, 105(4), 689-705. Ji, W., Kong, X., Yin, H., Xu, J., & Wang, X. (2022). Case Report: Novel Biallelic Null Variants SMPD4 Confirm Involvement Neurodevelopmental Disorder Microcephaly, Arthrogryposis, Structural Brain Anomalies. Frontiers Genetics, 13. Ravenscroft, G., Clayton, J. S., Faiz, F., Sivadorai, P., Milnes, D., Cincotta, R., … & Davis, M. R. (2021). Neurogenetic fetal akinesia arthrogryposis: genetics, expanding genotype-phenotypes functional genomics. Journal medical genetics, 58(9), 609-618. Monies, D., Abouelhoda, M., Assoum, M., Moghrabi, N., Rafiullah, R., Almontashiri, N., … & Alkuraya, F. S. (2019). Lessons learned large-scale, first-tier clinical exome sequencing highly consanguineous population. American Journal Human Genetics, 104(6), 1182-1201. Wickham, H. . (2014). Tidy Data. Journal Statistical Software, 59(10), 1–23. https://doi.org/10.18637/jss.v059.i10
